questions.text: I have consistent access to quality nutrition — I'm not constantly compromising due to scarcity or poor planning.
I get enough quality sleep that I have energy reserves, not just enough to get by.
My living environment supports rather than drains me — it's a resource, not a liability.
questions.principle: Environment can add or subtract energy

questions.text: I have financial margin for quality food, proper rest, and environmental maintenance.
My physical recovery consistently exceeds my physical expenditure — I'm building reserves, not depleting them.
